metadata.title: CVE-2019-15924 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.0.11.fm10k_init_module in drivers/net/ethernet/intel/fm10k/fm10k_main.c has aNULL pointer dereference because there is no -ENOMEM upon analloc_workqueue failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15924` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1004-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-1013.19').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
